answers.answer: No, this is not herpes.  For herpes to occur and cause pain without lesions is very, very unusual.  For this situation to occur with negative blood tests removes it from the realm of possibility.what could it be?  Your doctor is correct that fungal infections can cause discomfort and itching, usually with redness or a rash as well.  The fact that you improved with medication for yeast infection and then it came back makes me wonder if you were treated long enough.I would suggest you work on this with your doctor.  Could you be feeling anxious about this?Gook luck.  EWH

Thanks for your reply. My Doctor put me on a cream for 2 weeks(Clotrimazole Beta, Dipro 1%) I seemed to help but didn't stop it. Then I was placed on Duflo(abbr) 150mg one a  day for 5 days. Still Itching. This was from my GP now I'm going to the Derm Doctor. Also do you think enough time has pass for my test to be accurate even though my Diabetes may be slowing the anti- body process down.

question: had a sexual incounter at the end of July. The last week in August I started having syntoms of a sexually transmitted disease. In The last week in September I started with this genital itching and sometimes a sharp pain at the head of my penis, no rashes. This has been going on since then. I have had a HSV IgG test for both 1 & 2. I had negative results form this 18 week problem. CAn you have a Herpes outbreak for that long with constant itching is the problem on my scrotum, penis and sometimes it seems to be inside my penis. I also have Diabetes and my Doc said it could be yeast. I have been on a couple of treatments for yeast and they only stop for a lil while. Can you help.
title: Herpes or not?
